English for Hospitality 2

The aim of this module is develop students’ ability to both demonstrate awareness of the main conventions within report writing in business and academic environments, alongside utilising these conventions within their own contexts within hospitality. Students take on a discovery-based approach as they explore real-life industry examples of reports within the hospitality sector and identify the dominant conventions surrounding report structure, utilisation and representation of graphics and data, referencing of primary and secondary sources and stylistic conventions governing language use. Students will then apply awareness of these conventions to the development their own writing.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Set project vision, goal and specifications.

+  Prepare a feasibility study based on project vision & goal.

+  Prepare Gant charts and monitor work progress.

+  Use key techniques to manage internal and external stakeholder.

+  Apply problem solving techniques to ensure project progress.
